intro: Bukiniczia, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with a fibrous root system adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant features basal leaves that are typically gray-green in color, covered in a fine layer of hair to reduce water loss. Its flowers are small and yellow, resembling those of the dandelion, and appear in spring. Bukiniczia is valued for its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in desert ecosystems.
